Choropleth Map

In this section, you will learn about about the data for choropleth map, the color scheme, and the classification method.

TELL ME MORE

Figure 1. Choropleth Map - Population Density 2022

About Choropleth Map

'Choropleth' word comes from Greek
χῶρος (choros) = 'area/region' and
πλῆθος (plethos) = 'multitude' (from Wikipedia)

Choropleth map is one of common thematic maps. This map uses visual variable color value to visualize quantitative data.

Figure 2. Common Map Types from
Kraak MJ, RE Roth, B Ricker, A Kagawa, and G Le Sourd (2020)

Choropleth Map Data

From the previous section, we have learnt about data type just like it is shown in Figure 2. Choropleth map is used to represent Quantitative Data

The examples of Quantitative data which are 'Abrupt - Continuous' for Choropleth Map:
→ Population density, forest coverage percentage per cities, poverty index of a specific region

Choropleth Map Color Scheme

As you can see in Figure 3 beside, color scheme is one of the most important cosiderations of making a Choropleth Map.
There are two main color scheme:

⚪ Multi Hue

⚪ Single Hue

Figure 3. Color Brewer 2.0

Figure 4. Difference between equal interval and quantile histogram
for choropleth data classification

Choropleth Map Classification Method

From Figure 3, we can conclude that data classification methods can affect the appearance of the Choropleth map. There are several methods that can be used to classify data before it is visualized into a map, namely:

⚪ Equal Interval

⚪ Quantile (Equal Count)

⚪ Natural Breaks (Jenks)

⚪ Standard Deviation

⚪ Pretty Breaks

Create a Choropleth Map

See About Color Scheme

will be shown once you select the data
